com.sap.cloud.sdk.cloudplatform.servlet

Interface RequestContext

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRequestContext, HystrixDelegatingRequestContext

    public interface RequestContext
    This class represents the context of a request. It abstracts from the general assumption that a thread always corresponds to a request in a web container. This is necessary when request-specific information needs to be accessed from within threads that are not managed by the container. Instances of this class are normally initialized by RequestContextServletFilter. In case an instance is required outside the normal servlet lifecycle (e.g. within background tasks), refer to RequestContextExecutor.
    See Also:
    RequestContextListener

    • Method Detail

      • getRequest

        com.google.common.base.Optional<javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest> getRequest()
        Returns:
        The HttpServletRequest of this instance, if present. Can be absent if the RequestContext has been created by a RequestContextExecutor when running outside the normal servlet lifecycle (e.g. within background tasks).

      • getRequestThreadId

        long getRequestThreadId()
        Returns:
        The identifier of the original thread serving the request.

      • getProperty

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Object> getProperty(@NonNull
                                                    String name)
                                             throws RequestContextPropertyException
        Retrieves the property for the given name. Implementations have to ensure that this method is thread-safe.
        Throws:
        RequestContextPropertyException - If there is an issue while accessing the property.

      • setPropertyIfAbsent

        void setPropertyIfAbsent(@NonNull
                         String name,
                         @NonNull
                         Object value)
                  throws RequestContextPropertyException
        Retrieves the property for the given name. Implementations have to ensure that this method is thread-safe.
        Throws:
        RequestContextPropertyException - If there is an issue while setting the property.

      • removeProperty

        com.google.common.base.Optional<Object> removeProperty(@NonNull
                                                       String name)
                                                throws RequestContextPropertyException
        Removes the property with the given name.

        Caution: Implementations may not be thread-safe!

        Returns:
        The removed value, if present.
        Throws:
        RequestContextPropertyException - If there is an issue while removing the property.
